thread.title: Kirsten Flipkens breezes through to the Generali Ladies semi-finals
thread.title_full: Kirsten Flipkens breezes through to the Generali Ladies semi-finals

title: Kirsten Flipkens breezes through to the Generali Ladies semi-finals
text:
Kirsten Flipkens breezes through to the Generali Ladies semi-finals 16 Oct 2015 19:16:57 
comments 
Kirsten Flipkens continued her strong run in Austria as she comfortably beat Czech Republic's Denisa Allertova in straight sets at the Generali Ladies Linz on Friday. 
The Belgian, who upset numbr two seed Caroline Wozniacki in the previous round, and Allertova both secured two break points apiece in the first set before Flipkens secured a crucial break in the eighth game. The 29-year-old eventually served out the set to win it 6-3. 
Allertova, a finalist at the WTA Guangzhou Open, had her serve broken twice more in the second set before claiming a break in the sixth. 
But the world number 110 used all of her experience to seal the match, winning the set 6-4 and advance to semi-finals as she looks to secure only her second WTA singles title. 
Next up for Flipkens is seventh seed Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova after the Russian defeated Serbian qualifier Aleksandra Krunic 6-3 6-3. 
In a week where seeds have crashed out early Pavlyuchenkova, the highest seed left in the draw, needed three breaks of serve to emerge victorious. 
Elsewhere Germany's Anna Lena Friedsam advanced to her first WTA semi-final since winning the Investec Ilkley Open in August after a comprehensive straight-sets victory over Russia's Magarita Gasparyan. 
Friedsam, who has yet to drop a set in her previous two meeting against the Russian, needed an hour and 13 minutes to win 6-3 6-4, seizing three of five break point opportunities. 
The German will face world number 59 Johanna Larsson after she came out on top in her tightly contested quarter-final beating American Madison Brengle 7-5 7-6 (8/6). Related Sport News
